title: Neutron Bidography of Condensation and Evaporation of Hydrogen in a Cryogenic Condition
description: The presentation focused on the setup and preliminary images from a feasibility campaign. This was the first time neutron images of evaporating liquid hydrogen was presented. The presentation resulted in a [journal article](http://kishanbellur.github.io/files/bellur_2015.pdf) published in [Journal of Heat Transfer](https://journaltool.asme.org/home/JournalDescriptions.cfm?JournalID=10#)

title: A new experiment for determining evaporation and condensation coefficients of cryogenic propellants
description: NASA Early Stage Innovation Workshop on âMeasuring Accommodation Coefficientsâ.

title: Kinetic modeling and neutron imaging experiments of evaporation in cryogenic propellants
description: The graduate research colloquium is an opportunity to share student research with the university community and gain experience in presenting in a conference style setting.

title: A New Experiment for Determining Evaporation and Condensation Coefficients of Cryogenic Propellants
description: The presentation focused on the development of a new experimental method to determine accommodation coefficients. The ability to visualize liquid hydrogen was emphasized The presentation resulted in a [journal article](http://kishanbellur.github.io/files/bellur_2016.pdf) published in [Cryogenics](https://www.journals.elsevier.com/cryogenics)

title: Contact angle measurement of Hydrogen in a Cryogenic Condition
venue: The First Thermal and Fluids Engineering Summer Conference
description: Contact angles of liquid hydrogen as measured by neutron image analysis were discussed.

title: Neutron Radiography of Condensation and Evaporation of Hydrogen in a Cryogenic Condition
description: Wettability of hydrogen is investigated through neutron image processing using a conical cell and results discussed. The presentation resulted in a [journal article](http://kishanbellur.github.io/files/konduru_2016.pdf) published in [Journal of Heat Transfer](https://journaltool.asme.org/home/JournalDescriptions.cfm?JournalID=10#)

title: A new method to investigate evaporation and condensation of cryogenic propellants and determine accommodation coefficients
description: A poster presented to the chemistry community emphasizing the applicability of using neutron imaging to understand fundamental surface science.

title: Neutron Radiography for Determining the Evaporation/Condensation Coefficients of Cryogenic Propellants
venue: 69th Annual Meeting of the APS Division of Fluid Dynamics
description: Diagnostics of the cryo-neutron experiments and the ability to extract fundamental properties of the liquid-vapor interface.

title: Determining the evaporation and condensation coefficients of cryogenic propellants
description: The poster presentation won a 3rd place award in the graduate student category!

title: Determining solid-fluid interface temperature distribution during phase change of cryogenic propellants using transient thermal modeling
description: Kishan Bellur received a scholarship to travel/attend/present at this workshop. The presentation resulted in a [journal article](http://kishanbellur.github.io/files/bellur_2018a.pdf) published in [Cryogenics](https://www.journals.elsevier.com/cryogenics)

title: Neutron attenuation analysis of cryogenic propellants
description: The presentation resulted in a [journal article](http://kishanbellur.github.io/files/bellur_2018b.pdf) published in [Journal of Heat Transfer](https://journaltool.asme.org/home/JournalDescriptions.cfm?JournalID=10#)

title: A novel method to determine accommodation coefficients of cryogenic propellants
venue: 33rd Annual Meeting of the American Society for Gravitational and Space Research
description: The presentation focused on the ability to to combine experimental data with computational modeling to obtain the accommodation coefficients. Experimental data and progress on the modeling framework was presented.

title: Visualization of Evaporation/Condensation in Cryogenic Propellants
description: Kishan Bellur received the best oral presentation award!

title: A combined experimental and multi-scale modeling approach to determine phase change coefficients of cryogenic propellants
venue: Institute for Mathematics and its Applications (IMA), University of Minnesota
description: IMA workshop on Dynamic Contact Lines: Progress and Opportunitiesâ. Kishan Bellur received travel support to attend/present at this workshop.

title: Modeling of liquid-vapor phase change and associated processes
description: Invited by Prof. Mark Weislogel

title: Using neutron imaging to investigate cryogenic phase change
venue: Material Science and Engineering Seminar, Michigan Tech.
description: Invited by Prof. Jaroslaw Drelich.

title: Determining the evaporation and condensation coefficients of cryogenic propellants
description: The poster highlighted neutron imaging as an ideal probe to visualize cryogenic propellant phase change. Importance and applications of the accommodation coefficient of cryogenic propellants were discussed.

title: Grant Writing as a Graduate Student: Practical Tips and Benefits
venue: Material Science and Engineering Seminar, Michigan Tech.
description: Invited by Prof. Jaroslaw Drelich. Panel discussion with Jessica Brassard and Allison Hein.

title: Mass Accommodation Coefficients of Cryogenic Propellants
venue: 34th Annual Meeting of the American Society for Gravitational and Space Research, Washington,
description: The first estimates of the accommodation coefficient(s) for liquid hydrogen were presented. Kishan Bellur won the best poster award!

title: A combined experimental and multi-scale modeling technique to determine accommodation coefficients of cryogenic propellants
venue: Gordon Research Seminar on Micro and Nanoscale Phase Change Heat Transfer
description: The cryo-neutron experiments were presented in detail and the modeling effort was introduced briefly. The supplementary GRC talk addressed the model and the accommodation coefficients.

title: A combined experimental and multi-scale modeling technique to determine accommodation coefficients of cryogenic propellants
venue: Gordon Research Conference on Micro and Nanoscale Phase Change Heat Transfer
description: The multi-scale modeling methodology and the accommodation coefficients for liquid hydrogen and methane were discussed in detail. The supplementary GRS talk addressed the cryo-neutron experiments.

title: Thermo-Mechanical Phase Change Stability of Liquid-Vapor Meniscus
venue: ASME Summer Heat Transfer Conference, AIChE Symposium in Honor of Prof. Peter C. Wayner, Jr. II
description: The stability of thin liquid films was discussed from the context of liquid-vapor phase change. A new scaling analysis was presented.

title: Aerospace Engineering 101
description: This presentation to the local Houghton community included an outdoor model rocket launch demonstration.

title: Multiscale modeling of liquid-vapor phase change based on experimental data
venue: 35th Annual Meeting of the American Society for Gravitational and Space Research
description: The complete cryo-neutron story is presented in an integrated modular approach. The experiments, thermal transport analysis and multi-scale evaporation modeling are combined to generate the accommodation coefficients for both hydrogen and methane. The resulting values are independent of both container material and size and agree well with a fluid independent transition state theory prediction.

title: Neutron Imaging: a non-destructive diagnostic tool for cryogenic propellant investigations
description: Invited by Prof. K. T Vasudevan

title: Testing fundamental assumptions using Constained Vapor Bubble (CVB) data from ISS experiments
venue: 36th Annual Meeting of the American Society for Gravitational and Space Research

title: Liquid-vapor phase change: a cryo/neutron study
description: Invited talk for the Dept of Mechanical and Materials Enineering graduate seminar

title: Guess free evaporation modeling without adsorbed film constraints
venue: Surface Wettability Effects on Phase Change (SWEP) workshop
description: A pdf of the poster is avilable [here](http://kishanbellur.github.io/files/Bellur_SWEP_poster_2021.pdf)

title: Mass accommodation coefficients of cryogenic propellants: a cryo/neutron study
Testing the equivalence of phase change coefficients based on the constrained vapor bubble (CVB) data from ISS experiments
venue: 38th Annual Meeting of the American Society for Gravitational and Space Research
description: This presentation highlights Marangoni flow along the interface resulting in a complex wavy flow pattern. Steps toward determining phase change coefficients are discussed.

title: Neutron imaging of evaporation/condensation in cryogenic propellants: an accommodation coefficient study
venue: 75th Annual Meeting of the American Physical Society Ð Division of Fluid Dynamics (APS DFD)
description: Exerimental results from cryo/neutron imaging work were discussed. The data (neutron images, temperature and pressure measurements) were packed into a publicly accessible [database](https://data.mendeley.com/datasets/z5zc7kk76g/2) and disseminated through a [data article](https://kishanbellur.github.io/publication/bellur_2022a).

title: Exploring the inequality of evaporation and condensation coefficients based on ISS experiments
venue: 75th Annual Meeting of the American Physical Society Ð Division of Fluid Dynamics (APS DFD)
description: Preliminary results of the phase change coefficients were made available along with insight into possible inequality between the condensation and evaporation coefficients.

title: A CFD Model of Evaporation in Liquid Hydrogen without the Need for Tuning Coefficients
venue: 75th Annual Meeting of the American Physical Society Ð Division of Fluid Dynamics (APS DFD)
description: A new approach to model phase change without tuning coefficients was introduced.

title: Thin film evaporation modeling of the microlayer region in a dewetting water bubble
venue: 75th Annual Meeting of the American Physical Society Ð Division of Fluid Dynamics (APS DFD)
description: A custom thin-film evaporation model was develoed to describe the microlayer region of a dewetting water bubble. The model incorporates high spatio-temporal resolution film thickness and temperature measurements and shows the mass flux non-uniformity in the microlayer region during the dewetting process.

title: Modeling of Liquid Microlayer Region in a Dewetting Water Bubble
description: We use our thin film modeling in conjunction with high resolution experimental data to show that the evaporation coefficient is not a constant but varies with time/thermophysical properties during the ebullition process.

title: Resolving discrepancy in accommodation coefficients by rethinking equilibrium assumptions in evaporation modeling
description: The cryo-neutron dataset was used in conjunction with our multiscale evaporation model to show that the interface is non-isothermal. Most studies in the past have assumed an isothermal interface based on equilibrium arguements leading to the discrepency in reported values. We show that accounting for non-uniformity in temperature and pressure results in a predictable coefficient.

title: Results and lessons from cryogenic phase change experiments with LH2 and LCH4
description: Results and lessons from the cryo/neutron experiments were presented in detail in this 30 min lecture. The non-isothermal / non-equlibrium nature of the phase change process and its implication in reported coefficient values were discussed.
